Description: Dover Chemical Corporation has agreed to pay $1.4 million in civil penalties for the unauthorized manufacture of chemical substances at facilities in Dover, Ohio, and Hammond, Ind., the Department of Justice and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced today. The settlement resolves violations of the Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA) premanufacture notice obligations for Dover Chemical's production of various chlorinated paraffins. Dover Chemical produces the vast majority of the chlorinated paraffin products sold in the United States.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/dover-chemical-corporation-ohio-pay-14-million-unauthorized-production-chemical-substances
https://www.fmcsa.dot.gov/regulations/enforcement/national-listing-enforcement-cases-subject-name-closed-fiscal-year-2005-pdf
Notes: Year is fiscal year. Date is closing date.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 322221: Coated and Laminated Packaging Paper and Plastics Film Manufacturing
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Dover Chemical agreed to pay $41,336 reimbursement of response costs to the United States, and secure $7,400,000 of financial assurance for remedial work to be performed on site in settlement of allegations it released hazardous substances in Operational Unit 2 of the Dover Chemical Corporation Superfund Site that were a continuing danger or threat of danger to people and the environment.
Info Source: http://edocpub.epa.ohio.gov/publicportal/ViewDocument.aspx?docid=1108869

Description: Dover Chemical agreed to pay a $200,000 penalty in settlement of allegations that it had installed, modified and operated equipment without permits, and had violated other emission permits by exceeding emission levels and failing to follow recording and reporting requirements.
Info Source: http://edocpub.epa.ohio.gov/publicportal/ViewDocument.aspx?docid=677418
http://edocpub.epa.ohio.gov/publicportal/ViewDocument.aspx?docid=150531
